</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>MParg</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets string representation of an object to a custom string. For example it is possible to return "MyFerrari" instead of default "ce06b00# 164274: offroad_01_unarmed_f.p3d" when querying object as string: 
<code>[[hint]] [[str]] _offroad; //MyFerrari</code>
When a vehicle is created and named in the editor, the name becomes both the variable containing the vehicle object and the string representation of the vehicle object. [[vehicleVarName]] on the other hand is only string representation of the object. So if you want to refer to the actual object by its [[vehicleVarName]], an extra step needed to assign the object to a variable of the same name. For example to see and refer to offroad as myFerrari:
<code>_offroad [[setVehicleVarName]] "MyFerrari";
MyFerrari <template><title>=</title></template> _offroad;</code>
In multiplayer environment [[setVehicleVarName]] has to be executed on every PC if you want the custom name to be known everywhere. If vehicle is created and named in the editor, the vehicle name will be known globally automatically. <br>
To reset [[vehicleVarName]] and [[str]] representation of the object to original form set [[vehicleVarName]] to an empty string:
<code>_offroad [[setVehicleVarName]] "";</code> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object''' setVehicleVarName''' name </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> name: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[setVehicleVarName]] "aP";
aP = [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part><part><name> mp</name>=<value> Execute on every client </value></part><part><name/>=<value>
</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[vehicleVarName]]  </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>
